article.Body:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi has been advocating the idea of 'Sabka saath, sabka vikaas' and it seems Finance Minister Arun Jaitley presented the Union Budget in line with his commander's view. Arjun Ram Meghwal, MoS Finance reiterated the approach of the Financial Bill and said that this Budget will benefit everybody.

He highlighted that government has set aside Rs 3.9 lakh crore for the infrastructure and said this amount is the highest ever.

It is expected that the capex allocation for infrastructure spur economic activities and fuel job creation significantly. Besides, according "infrastructure status" to affordable housing projects will help industry players a leg up on the back of tax incentives they stand to gain.
